node.title: Holiday home rental prices are skyrocketing. Would you pay $22,000 a week?
node.description: The cost of accommodation along parts of the New South Wales South Coast reachÂ dizzying heights, with property owners taking advantage of Sydney's exodus after the lifting of COVID travel restrictions.
node.content:
["The price of taking a holiday on the New South Wales South Coast has skyrocketed, with some rentals listed for more than $10,000\u00a0per week.\u00a0", "McGrath Real Estate manager Kelly Robertson said the increase was due to a post-lockdown rush of Sydney travellers wanting to escape\u00a0combined with the popular peak season.", "She said all 70 of the properties she managed were fully booked over the Christmas-New Year period, and prices had risen by up to 30 per cent from last year as a result of the demand.", "\"We are moving over to a new booking system and the prices are not set tariffs, the system fluctuates,\" Ms Robertson said.\u00a0", "\"We enter a minimum amount and it sets the price for us depending on the season and demand.", "
Computer says how much?
", "Ms Robertson said a number of premium properties in the Mollymook area were listed for more than $10,000 per week for a family home.\u00a0", "Further north in Kiama Downs, some rentals were going for even more \u2014 a\u00a0property overlooking Jones Beach was listed for more than $22,000.\u00a0", "", "
A holiday home in Kiama Downs was listed on Airbnb for more than $22,000 a week.(Supplied)
", "But the price of most holiday homes being rented privately had\u00a0not increased so drastically, according to South Coast Escapes owner Catherine Shields.", "\"It would only be a handful of agencies using the dynamic pricing software,\" Ms Shields said.", "\"The vast majority of people are renting houses out through Airbnb or Stayz\u00a0and might have put them up 10 per cent, but not very much.\"", "Ms Shields said her business had\u00a0been busy with Sydney travellers in particular.", "She said it was a welcome influx after the COVID lockdown.", "", "
Catherine Shields owns a holiday rental business and believes good deals can be found.(Supplied)
", "\"Because a lot of people who own holiday houses have not got an ABN, they have not been able to claim any compensation for the losses on their rentals over the last couple of years,\" she said.", "\"A lot of people have done it really tough.", "She also recommended booking directly with the home owner\u00a0rather than through corporate websites for a better\u00a0deal.\u00a0"]
